Interview Descriptions: Look online to find opportunities then a phone call from HR is the next step prior to coming in for a 1:1 interview and testing. If all goes well then an other interview is set up with people you may or may not be reporting to. Very confusing to the prospective employee.
Interview Questions: What was the job you liked least and why?

title: Fundraising Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at City of Hope
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and two weeks later had initial interview
Interview Questions: Everything was fairly standard. Be ready to relate why your experience will make you a good fit for the fundraising division of the company.

title: Desktop Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at City of Hope (Irwindale, CA) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: The hiring is done through Insight Global as the recruiter. They like to test your skills first. The interview process is detailed, but please ask your questions to address any concerns.
Interview Questions: Usually the technical questions about your duties and the technology supported.

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at City of Hope
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough process with a number of interviews with behavioral based interview guides.  Met with a number of different hiring managers in the process.  It was a long process.  I was surprised I was offered the job!
Interview Questions: What do you know about the organization.  Why do you want to work here.Lots of generic questions actually.

title: Research Associate I Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at City of Hope
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to come in for an interview and during the process met with head of the lab and the post-doc I would have worked for.  They asked questions about my research background and skills.
Interview Questions: What is an example of a way you used knowledge and experience to solve a problem.

title: Philanthropy Position Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at City of Hope (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was recruited for a position - begged to be part of senior management! The process was misleading - I should have realized something was suspicious when I didn't meet anyone in the department I would be working with upon joining the organization.
Interview Questions: There weren't any - I should have been leery at that point!

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at City of Hope
Interview Descriptions: Making contact with the right individual with in the organization is going to be key to getting that interview.  The HR filters that review resumes are not going to pass along the qualified candidates.  You need to review contacts via linked in to find the right individual to submit your resume.
Interview Questions: Explain how your experience in the past directly relates to the position we are looking to fill?

title: Data Architect Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at City of Hope (Duarte, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, then got email from recruiter. Had to go in 3 times for interviews with different people (one doctor and two IT directors). Then one phone interview with C level executive.
Interview Questions: They seem to always ask if you know hl7.

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at City of Hope (Duarte, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted regarding a position via the phone. I had two interviews total with the manager (phone) and the director (in-person). The environment was very friendly and both interviews were more like back and forth conversations than a grilling interview.
Interview Questions: I was asked several gotcha questions in the form of "wrong" statements to see if I was paying attention. I politely corrected my interviewers and they were happy to see I 1) knew the answer and 2) spoke up.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at City of Hope (Duarte, CA) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: The Associate VP wanted me to be interviewed, vetted and hired prior to the end of the year, so once I was introduced, interviewed and background was checked the entire process length was 2-1/2 weeks.
Interview Questions: Why this job?  Where do you see yourself in five years?  Is that a firm salary amount that you're requesting?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at City of Hope (Duarte, CA) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Went into interview knowing the hospital's mission. I was asked a lot about medical and work ethics. Lasted about 20 minutes. The director was nice. I didn't feel intimidated and there were no complicated questions.
Interview Questions: What would you do to solve a coworker confrontation?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at City of Hope (Duarte, CA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process is lengthy.  Once you apply do not expect a response anytime soon.  It took me over 3 months from interview to hire date.  The background took almost 2 months to complete.  The HR staff are very helpful and very responsive once the process has begun, it is worth the wait and the hospital is a great place to be.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at City of Hope (Duarte, CA) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Hiring and interview process are standard faire will a day long interview consisting of 8 people , with an initial phone interview. The interviews take 30min to 1 hour each. The hiring process consists of background check as well as a health screening.
Interview Questions: None really.

title: CRA II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at City of Hope (Duarte, CA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Applied on the company website. Received a phone call after 1 week. Scheduled an interview with the administrator. Had a written test for medical terminology and case review. Then, interviewed by a couple of PI's. The PI's just asked me about my previous experience.
Interview Questions: Where will you be in 5 years from now

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at City of Hope (Duarte, CA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: need to interview with more than 5 professors. It will take more than a hour. Professor will ask about your personal interests and previous research experience. Finally, they will give you some time to ask them about their research.
Interview Questions: Most questions are predictable. Just be well prepared about your research experience and try to demonstrate strong interest in biology, especially something about medicine, therapy, cancer or diseases.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at City of Hope (Duarte, CA) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: Applied on Biocareers Sunday night and got a phone call from the PI early Monday morning. She said that she will hire me right after the interview. A little bit of technical questions regarding my previous work but she already did her homework reading my papers. Overall, easy interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Senior Accountant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at City of Hope (Duarte, CA) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: everything from your initial communications with the company, organization and planning of the interview, number and type of interviews, and any advice you might offer to other interview candidates. Bonus points for your perceptions of the people, office, and work culture.
Interview Questions: Do you think you would experience culture shock?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at City of Hope (Duarte, CA) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Contacted a person directly involved in the company instead of going through human resources, which made the process of interviewing and getting an offer more efficient. Love the environment and the philosophy behind their work
Interview Questions: What did you do in your last research position?

title: Clinical Research Associate II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at City of Hope (Duarte, CA) in Nov 2007
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with 4 clinical trials administratrors, 3 scientific research staff in research specific to position, and medical terminology test. Offer for interview was received by email. Follow up was expedient, likely due to the eagerness to fill position. Clinical trial administrators asked very general questions about skills and familiarity in clinical trials in oncology as a whole industry. Scientific researchers gave more insight in what would be entailed in the position on a daily and long term goals of the research project.
Interview Questions: Tell us about any challenges you had regarding getting along with others in the workplace?
